text:
So this famous episode from 
Friends where we learn about

Ross's musical skills is absolutely hilarious.
So let's learn some English vocabulary related

to music and laugh a lot along the way, and if 
you're new here every single week we make new

lessons so that you can understand fast 
speaking natives, without getting lost,

without missing the jokes and without subtitles.
Zi7ad said that our lessons help them practice old

words and expressions and learn new ones.
You will too, all you have to do is hit

the Subscribe button and the Bell below so 
that you don't miss any of our new lessons.

Phoebe then says, "Plus it's different." 
We sometimes use plus to mean "and."
Also it's used to add more information.

Example, "He's been studying hard for exams, 
plus he's been working at a bar at night."

By the way do you get frustrated when 
natives speak fast and you feel lost?

Well in our Fluent with Friends Course 
you will learn to master connected speech

like we've seen in this lesson, so you 
can confidently understand native speech.

Try it absolutely FREE with 
our 3-Part Masterclass.

Just click here or in the 
description below to sign up.

If you're a Friends fan like I am, then 
be sure that you check out all of our

lessons with this series after you finish the 
video. We have a ton of them in this playlist.

You can find that linked up here 
and down in the description below.
